newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Astrologer released from prison in Venezuela.
newsitem.headline: Astrologer released from prison in Venezuela.

text.p: An astrologer detained for predicting the demise of Venezuelan President Rafael Caldera was released on Thursday and said his forecast had not been politically motivated.
"It seems that among the taboo subjects is the health or mortality of the president," Jose Bernardo Gomez told Reuters in a brief telephone interview after his release.
Interior Minister Jose Guillermo Andueza said on Wednesday the secret police were investigating the "political implications" of the astrologer's prediction.

"It's a purely astrological prediction: he (Caldera) has Pluto ascending, Uranus on top of the sun, Mars reversing over his birth moon and an eclipse over the planet Quiron," Gomez said after spending two days in prison.
Gomez said he was kept in a small room with no bed, but insisted he was treated cordially.
The astrologer had told a conference on Oct. 12 that "Caldera will not pass 1997." Caldera, whose second presidential term ends in 1999, will be 81 in January.

Gomez is president of Venezuela's astrologers association and according to followers is one of the best in his field. Among his celebrated predictions was Caldera's surprise electoral triumph in 1993.
